page.title: 06Ashbourne as a Route Centre.
page.content: Ashbourne has been an important route centre since the middle ages.The main London to Derby to Manchester road went via Ashbourne.So did the Sheffield to Lichfield and Birmingham roads.Manchester from London went via Buxton.This led to the{Market}being{ formed in the 13th century. The present day traffic is heavy goods going to the main cities and construction traffic to Carsington Reservoir. Ashbourne is also a tourist centre for Dovedale and the Peak district,so there are seasonal tourist coaches and cars. Many residents are concerned about the volume of traffic going through Ashbourne.A{By-pass}has been proposed but a decision has not yet been made about the route it will take.
